definition: see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head

sentences.english: The wounded soldier opened his eyes once, but lost consciousness again immediately.
sentences.chinese: 那个伤员睁了一下眼晴随即又昏了过去。

sentences.english: When the woman heard these words, she gave a loud cry and lost her senses.
sentences.chinese: 这名乞妇听到这些话时，大叫了一声，接着昏了过去。

sentences.english: She had a shock and conked out.
The Dutchman just crumpled up and fainted.
sentences.chinese: 这个荷兰人瘫成一团泥，昏了过去。

sentences.english: She conked out when she saw a dead body lying on the steps.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到一具死尸躺在台阶上时，她昏了过去。

sentences.english: Jack is suspicious, and shoots Mason with a tranquilizer gun to knock him out.
sentences.chinese: 杰克感到怀疑，他用麻醉枪射击了梅森，把其弄昏了。

sentences.english: Today I just put my feet up on my desk and faint completely.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我干脆把腿撂到桌子上，整个昏了过去。

sentences.english: The blow on his head stunned him for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 击在他头上的一拳使他有一阵儿昏了过去。

sentences.english: In the process he exhausts himself and loses consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中他精疲力竭，昏了过去。

sentences.english: Where one of the figures had been there was something dreadful. He blacked out.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个人影变成了某种可怕的东西，他昏了过去。

sentences.english: The box fell on his head and knocked him senseless.
sentences.chinese: 这个箱子掉到他头上将他敲得昏了过去。

sentences.english: Fat-ass passes out. Hadley gets in a few more licks and finally stops.
sentences.chinese: 胖子昏了过去，哈德利又打了几下才最终停了下来。

sentences.english: But it seems more like laziness and bad planning.
sentences.chinese: 然在吾观之，此更似怠惰和昏招下的败笔。

sentences.english: The girl fainted, but she came around after an injection.
sentences.chinese: 那个女孩昏了过去，但是打了一针后就醒了过来。

sentences.english: When the teacher told Jane her mother dead, she keeled right over.
sentences.chinese: 当老师告诉简她母亲去世的消息时，她立即昏了过去。

sentences.english: She swelted when she saw blood.
sentences.chinese: 她一看见血便昏了过去。

definition: confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to lose one's head/to be out of one's mind/to be dazed
to faint from fear/to be frightened into fits/shell-shocked
